t.x: Can mean work/job, a task, or 'a thing/matter'. Also means the number 'one' (일, 이, 삼...).
e: I work / job / thing every day.
Work / Job / Thing is important in daily life.
Through work / job / thing, I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making work / job / thing a habit is key to improving quality of life.

t.x: Currency, wealth. One of the most commonly used basic words in daily life.
e: I money every day.
Money is important in daily life.
Through money, I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making money a habit is key to improving quality of life.

t.x: An affirmative response, or a reaction showing you're listening. Also used when answering the phone.
e: I yes / okay every day.
Yes / Okay is important in daily life.
Through yes / okay, I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making yes / okay a habit is key to improving quality of life.

t.x: Short form of '무엇'. Very commonly used in daily conversation. '뭐 해?' is one of the most common casual greetings.
e: I what every day.
What is important in daily life.
Through what, I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making what a habit is key to improving quality of life.

t.x: Short form of '이것'. Used to point to something nearby. Very commonly used in daily conversation.
e: I this (thing) every day.
This (thing) is important in daily life.
Through this (thing), I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making this (thing) a habit is key to improving quality of life.

t.x: An interrogative used to ask for reasons. Also used to express emotions or show dissatisfaction.
e: I why every day.
Why is important in daily life.
Through why, I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making why a habit is key to improving quality of life.

t.x: Time, or a unit of time. Basic vocabulary very frequently used in daily life.
e: I time / hour every day.
Time / Hour is important in daily life.
Through time / hour, I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making time / hour a habit is key to improving quality of life.

t.x: Emphasized form of 'quickly'. Often mentioned as a characteristic of Korean culture.
e: I hurry hurry / quickly every day.
Hurry hurry / Quickly is important in daily life.
Through hurry hurry / quickly, I maintain a regular lifestyle.
Making hurry hurry / quickly a habit is key to improving quality of life.
